skillTree.localised_description: This crystalline orb glimmers faintly with shifting hues of blue, pink, and orange, its core a perpetual swirl of glittering ash caught in an ever-changing spiral. Said to be a fragment of a Tzeentchian daemon's severed essence, the Prism of Infinite Ashes channels raw warp energy into the bearer’s spells. Zor’ead Warpscorched acquired this artifact from the smoking ruins of an ancient library devoted to Tzeentch. A horror disguised as an archivist sought to deceive him, but Zor’ead, consumed with ambition, bound the daemon in flames until it revealed the artifact’s secrets. When wielded, the prism allows Zor’ead to shape his spells with unparalleled precision. Each spell cast channels a surge of chaotic power, enhancing his magical potency and twisting the very fabric of reality. However, its usage is perilous; over-reliance risks uncontrollable explosions of warpfire that consume friend and foe alike.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +20

skillTree.localised_description: Hanging from Zor’ead’s neck is a jagged amulet crafted from molten bronze and threaded with threads of iridescent warpstone. Shaped like a writhing mass of flames, the pendant shifts and distorts depending on the observer’s perspective, sometimes appearing as an open maw, a chaotic flame, or even an ever-watching eye. The Pendant of Chimeric Fortunes was bestowed upon Zor’ead during his initiation into Tzeentch's deeper mysteries. Bound to his soul, it seethes with Tzeentchian power, providing protection against both physical and magical threats. In battle, the pendant twists fate itself, redirecting killing blows or shrouding the wearer in illusory fire that confounds even the sharpest warriors.

ui_effects.localised_text: Unit is invulnerable to damage (does not apply to summoned units)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Every blow landed by Zor’ead left an ember of instability burning within his foes. Before long, their bodies betrayed them, igniting in unholy flames that consumed both flesh and will.
Wherever Zor’ead trod, reality itself became an infection, twisting minds and cities alike. Through whispered promises and spiraling flames, cults grew like wildfire amidst the ruins

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Cultist of Tzeentch
	(local province)

Establish Cult action: -30% cost to perform
	(all characters)

skillTree.localised_description: Each spell cast by the enemy only fueled Zor’ead’s twisted delight, his strikes rebounding their power with chaotic precision. In his eyes, their despair was the sweetest gift Tzeentch could offer.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases when enemies cast spells.

skillTree.localised_description: With a howl of exaltation, Zor’ead devours the life of an ally, feeding their essence to the Changer of Ways. From the ashes, a blazing chariot of nightmare soared into battle, its flames born in their sacrifice.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Replaces the unit with a Burning Chariot

skillTree.localised_description: The air trembles as Zor’ead exhales a maelstrom of warpflame, searing reality itself into chaos. From the roiling inferno emerges flamers, shrieking their glee as they feed on the madness.

With a surge of warp energy, Zor’ead's form melts and reforms, his mortal flesh dissolving into a terrible conflagration. As an Exalted Flamer, his wrath scorchs the heavens, only to recombine anew, shielded by the blessing of endless mutation.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Blue Fire of Tzeentch Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Blue Fire of Tzeentch Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "Robes? Fool! We're going to battle, not a ball. Hand me my armour! ARMOUR!"
Spell after spell, grant the enemy no reprieve!
Magic is little threat to one so well-versed in its dark and terrible intricacies.
Sheathed in sorcery and guarded against attacks, the Spirit Warrior summons deadly flame.
A barrier of Tzeentchian magic surrounds the warriors of the Changer, guarding them from the tumult of close combat.
Devastating bolts of arcane fire strike the earth, igniting all in their radius.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: To sow discord and confuse the enemy, sending them down the wrong route or befuddling their senses.

effects.description: Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -3%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -8%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -15%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

items.colour_text: This crystalline orb glimmers faintly with shifting hues of blue, pink, and orange, its core a perpetual swirl of glittering ash caught in an ever-changing spiral. Said to be a fragment of a Tzeentchian daemon's severed essence, the Prism of Infinite Ashes channels raw warp energy into the bearer’s spells. Zor’ead Warpscorched acquired this artifact from the smoking ruins of an ancient library devoted to Tzeentch. However, its usage is perilous; over-reliance risks uncontrollable explosions of warpfire that consume friend and foe alike.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +20

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Baptized in a sea of warpflame during a daemon-led ritual, Zor'ead shed his devotion to the Great Maw and rose as Zor’ead Warpscorched, a chosen vessel of the Changer of Ways. His Firebelly magics twisted into an infernal fusion of his former elemental fire and the mutable power of Tzeentch. Each spell he cast caused his charred skin to writhe with blue and pink flames, his form both resistant to their burn and empowered by their volatile energy.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Wound action: Additional 10% chance of wounding target

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent in melee or casting spells.
Requires line of sight to the target
